description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows Distributed File System (DFS) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-30063), follow these steps:

1. Download and install the security update KB5039212 specific to your Windows version. Ensure you are using the appropriate build number as detailed below:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: 10.0.22631.3737
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: 10.0.22621.3737
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: 10.0.19043.4529
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: 10.0.10240.20680

2. For manual installations, visit the Microsoft Update Catalog and download the package from the links below:
   - [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
   - [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

3. Restart your system after the installation to ensure new configurations take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses improper restriction of names for files and other resources, leading to possible remote code execution vulnerabilities. Please ensure a backup of critical data is made prior to installation.

**Preconditions**:
- Appropriate build version must be verified before patching.
